      • showAlertDialog

        public static void showAlertDialog(android.content.Context context,
                                   int titleStringId,
                                   int messageStringId,
                                   int positiveButtonLabelId,
                                   int negativeButtonLabelId,
                                   DialogActionCallback actionCallback)
                            throws android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException
        Show a non-cancelable dialog box with a message, a positive and a negative button.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to show this dialog box. Can't be null.
        titleStringId - A valid resource id of the text to be shown in the title bar of dialog box. If you don't want to show a title, just pass -1 here.
        messageStringId - A valid resource id of the message to display.
        positiveButtonLabelId - A valid resource id of the text to show on positive button.If you don't want to show a positiveButtonLabelId, just pass 0 here.
        negativeButtonLabelId - A valid resource id of the string to show on negative button.If you don't want to show a negativeButtonLabelId, just pass 0 here.
        actionCallback - Callback interface for the positive and negative buttons for if you want to perform some action on button clicks. Can be null.
        Throws:
        Throws - Resources.NotFoundException if any of the resource not found.
        android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException

                                        int mode,
                                        java.lang.String key,
                                        java.lang.String value)
        The method will save the data in shared preferences defined by "sharedPrefName" and the key provided by "key" parameter
        Parameters:
        sharedPrefName - name of the container
        mode - private
        key - name of the key in which values are saved
        value - data to be saved associated to the particular key
        Since:
        2014-08-13

      • removeKeyFromSharedPreferences

        public void removeKeyFromSharedPreferences(java.lang.String sharedPrefName,
                                           int mode,
                                           java.lang.String key,
                                           boolean removeAll)
        The method will remove the data stored in shared preferences defined by "sharedPrefName" and the key provided by "key" parameter
        Parameters:
        sharedPrefName - name of the container
        mode - private
        key - name of the key in which values are saved
        removeAll - if true will remove all the values stored in shared preferences else remove as specified by key
